article.headline: Southern 71, Ark Pine Bluff 68
article.story: BATON ROUGE, La. (AP) -- Deforres Riley-Smith scored 22 points and made two free throws in the final seconds to help lead Southern University to a 71-68 win over Arkansas-Pine Bluff Saturday. V'Angelo Smith hit a 3-pointer with 9 seconds left to pull the Golden Lions within one, at 69-68. Larry Williams then fouled Riley-Smith, who made both his free throws to give the Jaguars (11-11, 10-2 Southwestern Athletic Conference) a 71-68 lead with 8 seconds remaining. Smith missed a final 3-pointer with 3 seconds left, and Southern got the rebound as time expired. Chris Alexander led Southern with 23 points and Jerrid Campbell grabbed 11 rebounds. William Byrd and Smith led Arkansas-Pine Bluff (7-13, 4-8) with 16 points each, and Jarvis Gunter added 10.
